abstract: A. O. Scott looks back at Spike Lee's 2002 film that takes place in the aftermath of the 9/11 attacks.
snippet: A. O. Scott looks back at Spike Lee's 2002 film that takes place in the aftermath of the 9/11 attacks.
lead_paragraph: In this week's Critics' Picks, A. O. Scott looks back at Spike Lee's 2002 film "25th Hour." It stars Edward Norton as Monty Brogan, a man experiencing his last day of freedom before going to serve a long prison sentence. It tracks him as he says his goodbyes and takes care of some unfinished business. "25th Hour" features a strong ensemble cast, including Brian Cox, Barry Pepper, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Anna Paquin and Rosario Dawson as Monty's girlfriend. "But the real love interest," Mr. Scott says, "is New York City itself." The film takes in the aftermath of the September 11 attacks and "it captures, better than any other movie, the mood of raw shock and grief that blanketed the city in those months." Have you seen "25th Hour?" Please share your thoughts in the comments area below.
